text: The French Open is one of the four Grand Slam tennis tournaments. It is played in Paris, France. The first competition was held in 1891.French Open History - URL accessed 15 March, 2009 The French Open is known for being the only Grand Slam played on a clay court.International Tennis Federation - URL accessed 15 March, 2009 On a clay court the ball bounces much slower and higher than on hard or grass courts. This makes it more difficult to win the point and rallies (the number of shots in a point) usually last longer. Players that excel on clay courts are called clay-court specialists. The tournament is played for four weeks. It starts in late May and finishes in early June. Sometimes, the French Open is called the Roland Garros tournament. Roland Garros was a well-known aviator from World War I who had the main tennis court named after him.French Open Venue - URL accessed 15 March, 2009 The singles winners in 2016 were Novak Djokovic and Garbi√±e Muguruza. The singles winners in 2015 were Stan Wawrinka and Serena Williams. == Records == * Men - Rafael Nadal has won 9 times: 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, and 2014. * Women - Chris Evert won 7 times: 1974, 1975, 1979, 1980, 1983, 1985, and 1986. == Sources == Category:Grand Slam tennis tournaments Category:Sport in Paris Category:1891 establishments in Europe Category:1890s establishments in France
title: French Open
